reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Colonial for one night. We had a nice room and the beds were extremely comfortable. We used the computer in the common area to research some places to visit in Boston. That room was comfortable, too. There were games you could play with your family and it was right outside the restaurant. We had stayed at this hotel 4 years earlier. They have done renovations since then and I would definitely go back next time I need to be in that area.
reviews.title: Nice comfortable room.

reviews.text: We found the hotel well located for convenient traveling in and around the Salem, Marblehead area and ot is not far from Boston either. Rooms were spacious, clean and quiet. The staff was helpful and polite. The beds were really comfortable. The food was excellent, although I only sample the breakfast menu. Facilities were fine. All in all a good experience. Will stay there again if the opportunity arises.
reviews.title: Great place, convenient, clean, safe!

reviews.text: We stayed here with the hope of a good nights sleep. Unfortunately the conference area was hosting a reunion of sorts which spilled out into the hallways and individual rooms until 2:00 am before finally being shut down by the local police. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Were going to party like its 1999.

reviews.text: This hotel suited our needs perfectly, aside for the room size. We slept over on our way up to Maine and on the way back. The decor is fresh, clean and classic. The guy behind the desk our first night there looked like he'd really rather be left alone, but on our second night, the girl was a lot more personable. The room basically fits a bed and 2 chairs and NOTHING else. This was an inconvenience for us, since we needed to fit 1)crib for our daughter 2)mini fridge 3)bike 4)suitcase 5)daughter's stroller. So after some discussion, they agreed to let us keep the bike in a storage closet.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here after having bid for a room for two nights on Priceline. We got a reasonable rate (@$92/night, including all of Priceline's fees), so that made our stay more enjoyable knowing we weren't paying too much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean and quiet, and the bed was full of fluffy blankets and a great mattress. We also liked the fruit and goodies with coffee they offered complimentary in the morning. It was nice having public computers and printers available in the lobby. The front desk employees were friendly.
reviews.title: Good Hotel 15 minutes North of Boston
Choose your room carefully
reviews.text: We found the location right off the highway very convenient for our needs. We mostly spent our time in Salem, MA (@ 20 minutes away), but we also spent an afternoon in Boston, which was easy to get to from the hotel.

The one downside of the hotel for us was how noisy the lobby was. I tried to relax there in front of one of the giant gas fireplaces, but the acoustics in the lobby (all flat surfaces) made all the noises there even louder. Not a big deal, but I had been looking forward to relaxing in front of the fire and couldn't after all.
reviews.title: There are better options

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Colonial Boston North Hotel & Conference Center from October 25-28th. We wanted to be on the outskirts of Boston, but have easy access to the city. The Sheraton fit the bill and didn't break the pocketbook. The room are spacious and well appointed. The beds are extremely comfortable, with great linens. The room was cleaned very well daily, and the staff are very accommodating. The Hotel is just off the expressway, and it took us about 15 minutes to get into the city. Good parking in Boston can be found in an unerground garage directly below Boston Common, central to all city attractions, and the Hop On-Hop Off buses which is a great way to see the city.
reviews.title: Highway noise and Hair in bathroom

reviews.text: The room was nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was not worth it, best to go elsewhere for eats. Otherwise, I enjoyed the stay. Was there on business so I did not spend much time in the hotel, it's only a place to spend the night. For that it was good.
reviews.title: Fine place to sleep.

reviews.text: We stayed here a few weeks ago for a weekend trip to Mass., and were incredibly disappointed by pretty much everything! Our bad experience began at the front desk, where the girl who was working was rude and short with us. As we walked to our room, we were practically stampeded by about a thousand high school girls who must have been all staying as a group. Needless to say, screams and giggles were heard throughout the hotel for the rest of the weekend. Our room was extremely small and cramped, as was the bathroom. The two "queen-sized" beds were merely full beds, and the bedding was awful - we woke up constantly throughout the night to find that the covers had slid onto the floor. Not to mention the mattress felt like a bail of hay.
reviews.title: Poor service, bad value. Will not return!

reviews.text: The list goes on... More than half of the TV channels had no sound, some of the lights didn't turn on, and I found a large spider in the room. I tried to take a nap during the day but the cleaning ladies were making too much noise in the hallways. When we ran out of towels (which they only gave us two of) and shampoo, I called down to the front desk asking for more.. It took them a half an hour to get to our room, and all they brought was one towel, no shampoo.
reviews.title: Nice upgraded facilities but watch the food!

reviews.text: No complimentary breakfast at this place, instead we paid $15 a person for a buffet that was nothing special and should have been included.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: All in all, we had a terrible experience and will not return to this hotel. Save your money and try somewhere different.
reviews.title: One night was enough
